In this job, you'll be responsible for the test automation approach and methodology for quality assurance of BT/EE platform solutions. You'll provide technical leadership and strategic direction to automation or qa engineers, resolving the test project issues, and ensuring effective test process improvement feedback. You'll be critical in ensuring that test architecture and test plans are up to date relative to changes in the Digital landscape. You'll confidently lead and share knowledge with a team of engineers. You'll be involved in planning and monitoring the execution of automation tests in a CI/CD environment. You'll define the automation first approach within development sprints, and identify issues with the manual activities whilst using your own initiative to find the right solution for any faults found in dev, test and production. Excellent communication skills are required as you will be liaising with a wider engineering team including operations and product teams. You will also be responsible for implementing the latest technology, in line with our continuous integration and delivery goals. Working collaboratively across both QA and Engineering to achieve testability, maintainability and scalability of our software products, providing technical guidance and coaching throughout.

details.description:
The Change Manager is a pivotal role within the organization, responsible for driving and managing the change management process and initiatives across various departments. This role involves creating, implementing change strategies; monitoring processes, and workflows to ensure successful adoption of changes while minimising disruptions to business operations. The Change Manager will work closely with cross-functional teams to facilitate seamless change implementation and foster a culture of continuous improvement.


Responsibilities:

  • Develop and execute comprehensive change management strategies to support organisational initiatives and projects.
  • Collaborate with project teams to integrate change management activities into project plans, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives.
  • Identify potential risks and obstacles to change and develop proactive mitigation strategies.
  • Design and optimise change workflows that outline clear steps, roles, and responsibilities for implementing and managing changes.
  • Define change control processes to ensure all changes adhere to established guidelines and best practices.
  • Conduct regular audits of change management processes and documentation to ensure adherence to standards and identify areas for enhancement.
  • Continuously improve change management methodologies based on industry best practices and lessons learned.
  • Establish and enforce change management policies, procedures, and standards across the organization.
  • Conduct regular quality checks on change processes and documentation to ensure accuracy and compliance.
  • Evaluate the effectiveness of change initiatives and recommend improvements based on analysis and feedback.
  • Define and track relevant KPIs to measure the success and impact of change management efforts.
  • Analyze KPI data to identify trends, areas for improvement, and opportunities for optimisation.
  • Build strong working relationships with stakeholders at all levels to foster collaboration and gain support for change initiatives.
  • Communicate change objectives, progress, and benefits to ensure buy-in and alignment with organizational goals.
  • Develop and deliver clear and concise communication plans to keep employees informed about upcoming changes and their implications.
  • Coordinate training and development programs to equip employees with the skills and knowledge required to embrace change.


Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree.
  • Proven experience in change management, project management, or a related role.
  • Strong understanding of change management principles, methodologies, and best practices.
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal, and stakeholder management skills.
  • Analytical mindset with the ability to analyse data, identify trends, and make data-driven recommendations.
  • Ability to adapt to a dynamic and fast-paced environment, managing multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Proficiency in change management software and tools is a plus.
  • Change management/ ITIL certification is desirable
details.title: Change Manager

details.description:
As a Senior or Lead Software Engineer (Android) at Gather, you apply your wealth of Android app/firmware development experience to the exciting challenge of making flying robots (drones) do real, valuable work. You will design, develop, and maintain our Android-based application with our team of world-class autonomy engineers.


For many, this is the dream job that you went into computer science to pursue, but perhaps wasn't available to you when you graduated because the tech wasn't ready, or there wasn't a team of world class autonomy and ML engineers backing you up. Or perhaps you're an app framework or game developer with frontend/backend experience that's looking to move from controlling virtual characters to commanding robot IRL.


Either way, you're excited and motivated to apply strong CS fundamentals to the challenges of orchestrating real-time robot motion from an Android application, moving data through local and cloud-based ML pipelines, all through a great UI/UX.


Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement an application architecture and supporting components for a new Android-based drone control application. To accomplish this, you will define and apply best practice CS threading, API/communication, and software abstraction principles within a hybrid Android/C++ app ecosystem that interacts concurrently with real hardware, humans, and cloud services.
  • Collaborate with a team of world-class Autonomy, Machine Learning and Full-stack experts to continue to develop and evolve our automated inventory monitoring and data gathering logic within this Android application.
  • Improve and invent UI/UX, logging, and cloud data synchronization patterns. Gather faces the unique challenge of building a local app-controlled robotic system that operates autonomously and feeds timely data back to cloud-based web applications for deeper analysis.
  • Contribute to the team at a senior level by steering our app product roadmap, product designs, software architecture, and by mentoring other less experienced developers.
  • Help us evolve our autonomy engine to maximise shared logic across dual iOS/Android offerings.
  • Build and maintain build scripts, tooling, and unit testing fundamental to building a mature, easy to evolve and release CI/CD application platform.


Requirements:

  • BS in Computer Science/Engineering, or equivalent technical experience.
  • Strong interest and experience (10+ years, no upper limit) developing applications that stretch typical app frameworks to their limits. This may include challenging threading, synchronization, hardware interaction, or real-time interactive component design.
  • Deep experience with the Android ecosystem, including Kotlin/Java.
  • Experience designing and communicating application architectures.
  • Experience designing and implementing safe, secure, and efficient data exchange with cloud systems.
  • Comfort building and maintaining atypical compilation configurations, and dealing with the more complex than typical library dependency challenges that come with cross-platform robotics/hardware development.
  • Good writing skills, mentoring skills, and a design-for-test ethos.
  • Customer obsession! We are a customer-obsessed company. If you are not already customer-obsessed, expect to become so!
  • Leadership skills! You will be the lead developer of our Android platform. If the skill and interest is there, Gather is a growing company solving hard problems, which demands highly technical leadership.
  • More than 10 years of experience, and possibly some prior startup growth experience. We are a small but fast growing company, and we move quickly!
  • Experience with the challenges of incorporating C++ code and libraries (in our case, robotics logic) within Android ecosystems, e. g. via Android NDK/JNI.
  • Proficiency and interest in developing cross-platform (Android/iOS) applications.
  • Experience with peer-to-peer (tethered or untethered) communications with other devices. Even more bonus points if you have worked with DJI's Mobile SDK.
  • Experience building/maintaining cpu-constrained, soft real-time systems through appropriate threading and task prioritization schemes (like video games! )
  • Image and video processing experience within Android, and/or via common open source C++ libraries like OpenCV, FFmpeg, etc.
  • Experience CI/CD testing and releasing production software through the app store ecosystem, in an automated way, e. g. via Fastlane, Bitrise, GitHub Actions, Firebase, etc.
  • Prior experience controlling/interacting with hardware from an app.
  • UI/UX experience (or at least comfort implementing UI/UX components. )
  • A love for robotics and/other real-time multi-agent technology development (e. g. multi-player games) and the challenges that come with this unique space.

As an integral part of Kombai's initial engineering team, you'll work directly with our CEO, CTO & experienced engineers to build the next phase of Kombai. Together, we'd have a crack at a number of hard, high-impact problems - often involving challenges across product, engineering, and research areas. Our engineering team members often work on a diverse range of problems, all across the product development lifecycle and using latest tech stack. Below are some of the broad areas that we are currently working on:

Extending Kombai's code generation abilities to make it compatible with new frameworks and libraries

Improving the accuracy and quality of Kombai's code generation capabilities by optimising existing algorithms and/or implementing new novel ones

Integrations with various tools and platforms

Discovering solutions for specific problems for frontend and full-stack developers, and implementing features and workflows to solve them

Building multiple applications, e. g., browser plugins, IDE apps, web apps, etc.

Making our app and infrastructure performant at scale

Note: This is an individual contributor role and is best suited for folks who want to build long-term careers as world-class engineering ICs.

However, we believe a good understanding of application building in general, and frontend engineering in particular, is important to understand our problem space, product and target users.
